Hello Mr. Papa,

I’ve been tasked to write client side tests using Qunit for an application my teammates have built based off your Pluralsight tutorial, “Building Large Scale Apps with Angular and Breeze”. Although all the tutorials for testing Angular applications are fairly simple, this one is not so much. So I decided to add a Qunit test to your tutorial application, but I can’t get past the first line in my Qunit code following code:

var injector = angular.injector([‘ng’, ‘app’]);

Error: [$injector:unpr] Unknown provider: $rootElementProvider <- $rootElement <- $location <- $route http://errors.angularjs.org/1.2.16/$injector/unpr?p0=%24rootElementProvider%20%3C-%20%24rootElement%20%3C-%20%24location%20%3C-%20%24route

What is your suggestion to get passed this hurdle?

Respectfully,
